subject: Career
title: Anchoring Your Salary Expectation
description: Learn Anchoring Your Salary Expectation in one minute.

hook.text: The first number spoken in a salary discussion becomes the anchor. Everything revolves around it.

buildup.text: Anchoring bias means the initial figure disproportionately influences the final outcome.

discovery.text: If they anchor low, you're negotiating up from their number. If you anchor first, they adjust to yours.

twist.text: But anchoring too high can end the conversation. The anchor must be aggressive yet defensible.

climax.text: Research shows the party who names a number first usually gets a better outcome.

punchline.text: Whoever sets the anchor controls the range.

quiz.question: Why is the first salary number important?
options: It anchors the entire negotiation range
